name: misorder
content:
misorder verb [T]
(ARRANGE WRONGLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to put things in the wrong order: It was suggested that some children misorder compound nouns because they do not appreciate the semantic relationship between the parts. Poor punctuation can affect the meaning of a sentence as significantly as mis-ordered words.
More examplesFewer examplesThis was not a misordered formulation of the target language, but rather an utterance with a different intention.

Making mistakes
misorder verb [T]
(REQUEST WRONG THING)
to make a mistake when asking for something to be made, supplied, or delivered: It sounded as if he had misordered the takeaway food.
